meanings.definition: To change the order or arrangement of a set of things
meanings.sent1: She enjoys permutating her room furniture to create a new look.
meanings.sent2: The students are permutating the seating plan for the class.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to permutate the ingredients in the recipe for fun.
meanings.sent4: His mind was permutating ideas like a master puzzle solver.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to be permutating the leaves on the trees in the park.

meanings.definition: To rearrange in all possible ways
meanings.sent1: The computer program is permutating the numbers to find the best sequence.
meanings.sent2: They are permutating the colors to see which combination looks the best.
meanings.sent3: The kids were permutating their toys to see if they could find a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were permutating like a whirlwind of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The artist was permutating the shapes in the painting to create a unique design.
